relation: Define the picture settings. More details. Horizontal alignment can be 'l', 'r', or 'c', for left, right and center. Vertical alignment can be 't', 'b', or 'c', for top, bottom and center.
Display the album art bitmap. More details
Use in a conditional to check if album art has been loaded
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {4253=Quite simply, enter the WPS code in your favourite text editor, Notepad on Windows works fine. When you save it, instead of saving it as a .txt file, save it as a .wps file. Example: Instead of Rockbox.txt, save the file as Rockbox.wps. To make sure non english characters display correctly in your WPS you must save the .wps file with UTF-8 character encoding. This can be done in most editors, for example Notepad in Windows 2000 or XP (but not in 9x/ME) can do this.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {31972=For example, "%ca, %cb %cd, %cH:%cM:%cS" will display (assuming it's January 1st, a Sunday, at 04:10 and 42 seconds) "Sun, Jan 01, 04:10:42".}
textBeforeTable: Any viewport can be conditionally displayed with minor changes to the above syntax. Conditional Viewports The width and height values may also be negative which means almost the same as above (e.g. %V(50,-,-50,-,-) will go from 50 to 170 on a 220-pixel display). The x, y, width and height values value may also be negative specified which means almost the same as above... percentages, the actual value will be calculated from the target's display at load time. Percentage parameters can be mixed with normal ones. Percentages can carry upto 1 fractional digit for increased precision. Example: %V(10.5%,10,80%,80,-) The x and y values may be negative which means "pixels from the far edge".. i.e x == -50 means 50 pixels from the right edge default shade (2bit lcd's) is black FG on white BG default colour (16 bit lcd's) is the theme colours default font is the user font default width/height is the remaining part of the screen Only the x and y values need to be specified. The rest can be left blank empty if you want to use their default values (but it still needs the correct amount (use '-' to achieve this, e.g. %V(0,0,-,-,1)). of , 's with -'s in the blank fields, i.e. %V(0,0,-,-,1). Viewports
textAfterTable: Info Viewport (Base Skin (.sbs) only) Tag Description %Vi(label,....) This viewport is used as Custom UI Viewport in case the theme doesn't have a ui viewport set in the theme.cfg. Using '-' for the label means it is used by default. Having this is strongly recommended since it makes you able to use Custom Status Bars with other themes. If label is set this viewport can be selectivly used as the Info Viewport using the %%VI tag %VI(label) Set the Info Viewport to use the viewport labeled label LCD type Colour values Mono no colours. tag ignored Greyscale in the range 0 (= black) to 3 (= white) Colour 6-digit RGB888 colours - e.g. FF00FF Viewport Colours
